Dogtooth Lake Wrapped in a Blanket of Pines: Ontario Lakes Project

05 Apr 2013

One of the most marked features of Kenora’s Dogtooth Lake is the presence of towering pine trees, all of equal height, surround the lake. The trees are the result of a huge fire in 1910 that cracked open pine cones and heat resistant seeds were scattered along the shoreline. Â This protective blanket of trees gives the lake a particularly picturesque look, all year long.
